adverse_effects_notes: Observed  instances of sand getting caught in the tape’s leading edge. One snake repeatedly got tangled in dense and exposed vegetation roots at an eroded streambank immediately after tape attachment and another appeared stuck trying to maneuver around a semi-collapsed burrow; we removed the transmitter in both instances.

A field evaluation of two external transmitter attachment methods for small snakes
adverse_effects_notes: Injuries and death; 3 out of 4 were injured and tracking had to be terminated. Transmitters got stuck in rock crevices. Authors suggest technique not suitable for species that use narrow rock crevices as shelters or corridors. The nylon thread, which is strongly pulling backward, may have been responsible for the injury of one of the snakes.

title: A field evaluation of two external transmitter attachment methods for small snakes
Movement pattern and habitat use of female grass snake (Natrix natrix) in a semi-urban environment
adverse_effects_notes: On occasion, the snakes got stuck in denser parts of the vegetated areas but they were able to get loose with little problem. Movement was limited around the package as they could not bend this part as well but this stiffness seemed to disappear after a few days in the field. One problem experienced with this attachment was that it led to smaller abrasive wounds anterior of the package.
